meanings.definition: An intense feeling of fear, shock, or disgust.
meanings.sent1: The horror of the dark forest sent shivers down his spine.
meanings.sent2: The movie was full of horrors that made everyone jump in their seats.
meanings.sent3: She tried to laugh off her horrors of spiders, but deep down, she was terrified.
meanings.sent4: The horrors of war can leave scars that never fully heal.
meanings.sent5: The haunted house was a place of unspeakable horrors.

meanings.definition: A cause of fear or dread.
meanings.sent1: The abandoned house was a horror to the neighborhood kids.
meanings.sent2: The thought of failing the test was one of his greatest horrors.
meanings.sent3: His horror of clowns was so extreme that he ran away from the circus.
meanings.sent4: The horrors of the unknown can be more frightening than anything tangible.
meanings.sent5: The horror of losing a loved one is a pain that never truly goes away.

meanings.definition: A strong feeling of dislike or aversion.
meanings.sent1: She couldn't hide her horror of the taste of mushrooms.
meanings.sent2: The horrors of broccoli made him refuse to eat his vegetables.
meanings.sent3: His horror of public speaking was so strong that he avoided it at all costs.
meanings.sent4: The horrors of bad manners can ruin even the best of meals.
meanings.sent5: The horror of the dentist kept her from making an appointment for years.
